Brief Hospital Course:
PATIENT SUMMARY FOR ADMISSION:
==============================
Ms. ___ is a ___ w/ HFpEF (EF 65% ___, atrial 
fibrillation/flutter on apixaban, HTN, HLD, previous CVA, DM 
(A1C 8.6% ___, OSA on CPAP & home O2, mixed 
restrictive-obstructive lung disease (PFTs ___, previous 
CVA, CKD III, relapsing polychondritis on immunosuppression, & 
history of gastric cancer s/p abdominal surgery (@ ___ ___ years 
ago) & cervical cancer, who presents w/ diarrhea & ___ on CKD. 

ISSUES ADDRESSED:
=================
# ___ on CKD:
Presented with Cr 4.9 on admission from baseline above ___ 
baseline of ~1.1. FEurea 24.7%, Urine Na 23, BUN/Cr 11.4, Urine 
OSM 311. This gives a mixed picture but w/ the clinical picture 
was mostly suggestive of pre-renal etiology in the setting of 
copious diarrhea, diuretic use (torsemide), & anti-HTN therapy 
w/ lisinopril. Obstructive causes r/o on CT w/ no evidence of 
hydronephrosis or pelvic masses. Intrinsic etiologies were 
difficult to definitively r/o but UA was bland on microscoping 
evaluation. The patient in no urgent indications for 
hemodialysis. She was hydrated and renal function very gradually 
downtrended to 2.2 on discharge. 

# Essential HTN:
Held home amlodipine & lisinopril in setting of pre-renal ___ 
with the goal of permissive HTN given renal injury (SBP 
130-160). Amlodipine restarted, then home metop changed to 
labetalol for better BP control. Lisinopril held.

# Abdominal pain:
# ?SBO:
ACS consulted, CT was initially concerning for small bowel 
obstruction however on further read no obstruction was noted. 
She had a normal Gastrografin study and diet was advanced. 

#Diarrhea:
Resolved. C. difficile & Norovirus negative. 

# HFpEF:
Grade II diastolic dysfunction, EF 65% on TTE (___). Home 
toremide held on admission given ___. 

# Relapsing polychondritis:
Followed by ___ Rheumatology. We continued azathioprine 100mg 
QD (prednisone taper ended ___ + azithromycin QWeek. 

# Diabetes mellitus:
A1C 8.6% ___. Continued 70/30 insulin and held metformin. 
Held gabapentin given ___. 

# Mixed restrictive-obstructive lung disease:
On home O2. Supplemental O2. Continued home tiotropium + 
albuterol PRN. 

# Atrial fibrillation/flutter:
-Rhythm: No AADs.
-Rate: On metoprolol, initially held to allow for permissive 
hypertension, then changed to labetalol as patient was 
hypertensive
-AC: On apixaban at home, placed on heparin drip on admission in 
the setting of possible need for surgical intervention and ___, 
restarted when GFR was > 30. 

# HLD:
Continued home atorvastatin.

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Ms. ___,

It was a pleasure taking care of you at ___.

WHY WERE YOU ADMITTED?
-You are having diarrhea and your kidneys were not working as 
good as they should.

WHAT HAPPENED WHEN YOU WERE HERE?
-We gave you fluids to help hydrate your kidney and your kidney 
function improved but is still not back to normal. This will be 
closely monitored as an outpatient. 
-We tested you for 2 infections that can cause diarrhea and 
there was no evidence of infection. 
-There were some concerns initially that you had a bowel 
obstruction, but we did studies that showed that you did not 
have this.  

WHAT SHOULD YOU DO WHEN YOU GO HOME?
-Continue take all of your medications as prescribed.
-Go to all of your appointments.  Please do not hesitate to 
return to the hospital
-Continues take all of your medications as prescribed if you 
have any symptoms that concern you. 
We wish you the best!

Sincerely,
Your ___ Medicine Team
